==PowerVR Video/Display Cores(PDP)== '''NEC EMMA 3TL'''â''PDP'' * Sony Bravia TV's
==Series5 (SGX)== * PowerVR SGX (pixel, vertex, and geometry shader hardware) ** next generation fully programmable universal scalable shader architecture ** exceeding requirements of OpenGL 2.0 and up to DirectX 10.1 Shader Model 4.1 ** licensed to [[Apple Inc]], [[Sony]], [[Intel]], [[Nokia]], [[Renesas]], [[NEC]], [[Texas Instruments|TI]], [[MediaTek]], [[NXP Semiconductors]], [[Realtek]], [[Samsung]], [[Sigma Designs]], [[SigmaTel]], [[SiRF]], [[SiS]] and others ** size from 2.6 mmÂ² to 12.5 mmÂ² (@65 nm) ** 6 variants announced (realistic, sustainable, less than 50% shader load, real-world performance listed at 200 MHz; peak performance significantly higher dependent on content and operating conditions) — *** SGX520 (7 mil [[:wikt:en:poly#Noun|Triangles]]/sec, 250Mpx/s@200 MHz) for the handheld mobile market<ref>{{Citation |last=Murray |first=Bruce |title=POWERVR SGX IP Core Family |format=[[Portable Document Format|PDF]] |publisher=[[Imagination Technologies]] |date=2008-11-10 |url=http://www.imgtec.com/factsheets/powervr/POWERVR_SGX_IP_Core_Family_%5B2.2%5D.pdf |accessdate=2010-12-13}}</ref> *** SGX530 (14 mil [[:wikt:en:poly#Noun|Triangles]]/sec, 500Mpx/s@200 MHz)for the handheld mobile market *** SGX535 (14 M Triangles/s, 1Gpx/s@200 MHz, Max Memory Band 4.2GB/s), For handheld high-end mobile, portable, [[Mobile Internet device|MID]], [[Ultra-Mobile PC|UMPC]], consumer, and automotive devices.licensed by [[NEC]].<ref>{{cite web |title=NEC |work=Licensees |publisher=Imagination Technologies |year=2010 |url=http://www.imgtec.com/partners/NEC.asp |accessdate=2010-12-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release |title=NEC Electronics Introduces NaviEngineÂ®1 Multicore Platform for Car Navigation Systems.|publisher=[[Renesas Electronics Corporation]] |date=2007-10-02 |url=http://www2.renesas.com/news/en/archive/0710/0201.html |accessdate=2010-12-13}}</ref> Intel calls it the [[Intel GMA#GMA_500|GMA 500]]. *** SGX540 (20M Triangles/s(Built-in Samsung S5PC110-111) 1Gpx/s@200 MHz,Built-in SOC.<ref>{{Citation |last=Lee |first=Ticky |title=Samsung c110 Introducing |work=With Samsung USA |publisher=Samsung USA |year=2010 |month=December |url=http://www.samsung.com/us |accessdate=2010-12-25}}</ref> *** SGX545 (40 M Triangles/s, 1Gpx/s@200 MHz)<ref>{{Citation |last=Williams |first=Nicola |title=POWERVR SGX545 announced |work=With Imagination |edition=Issue 7 |page=3 |at=right-side section |format=PDF |publisher=Imagination Technologies |year=2010 |month=February |url=http://www.imgtec.com/Newsletters/with_imagination/issue7_10.pdf |accessdate=2010-12-13}}</ref> Products that include the SGX:

==Series5XT (SGXMP)== * PowerVR SGXMP variants available as single and multi-core IP 543XT, 544XT, and 554XT series ** Performance scales 95% linearly with number of cores and clock speed
* Available in single to 16 core variants ** SGX543 ***(single core) 35M polygon/s @200 MHz ***(two cores) 68M polygon/s @200 MHz ***(four cores) 133M polygon/s @200 MHz ***(eight cores) 266M polygon/s @200 MHz ***(sixteen cores) 532M polygon/s @200 MHz
* Licensees: ** Sony ** Renesas ** Texas Instruments ** Apple ** Intel (rumored)
[[PlayStation Vita]] * SGX543MP4+ (four cores)
Renesas G5/AG5/APE5R * SGX543MP2 (two cores)
Texas Instruments Omap5430 & Omap5432 * SGX544MPx Undisclosed number of cores
[[Apple A5]] - SGX543MP2 (two cores) <ref>http://www.anandtech.com/show/4216/apple-ipad-2-gpu-performance-explored-powervr-sgx543mp2-benchmarked</ref> * Apple [[iPad 2]] * Apple [[iPhone 4S]]
==Series6== {{Unreferenced|date=September 2011}} * Code name:Rogue * delivers unrivalled{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} GFLOPS per mm2 and per mW for all APIs * 100x faster{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}} than MBX in Apple iPhone or Nokia N95 in the same power envelope * fully compatible with Series5 and Series5XT GPUs, ensuring a smooth migration path for developers upgrading applications optimized for Series5 to the new architecture{{Citation needed|date=September 2011}}. * Licencees '''ST-Ericsson''' *Nova A9600, 210G FLOPs, 350M polygons/s, fill rates in excess of 13Gpixels/sec, sampling in 2011 <ref>http://www.stericsson.com/press_releases/NovaThor.jsp</ref>
'''Texas Instruments''' *OMAP 5xxx/6xxx '''MediaTek'''
